alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 26 at 4:41PM EDT until April 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms that produced the heavy rainfall has moved out of the advisory area. However, rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over this area from the earlier thunderstorms. This amount of rainfall will take some time to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 6 PM this evening for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jupiter, Palm Beach Gardens, Riviera Beach, Tequesta, Juno Beach, North Palm Beach, Lake Park, Juno Ridge, Fau North Campus, Limestone Creek, Philo Farms and Jupiter Farms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
